oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Conservation of natural resources; Soil conservation
Civilian Conservation Corps (U.S.); New Deal, 1933-1939
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Two unidentified officers of Civilian Conservation Corps Camp No. 496 standing in front of headquarters.

Captain Hoke S. O'Kelly was commanding officer of Civilian Conservation Corps Camp 496 which was created to combat soil erosion and was located in Lexington, TN. The Civilian Conservation Corps facilitated the spread of kudzu by planting millions of seedlings as part of an extensive soil erosion project.
